location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

mods.abstract: The map originally produced by Colonel Sheil in 1852 shows the various boundary lines in the province of Zohab.The red dotted line shows the boundary line proposed by the mediating commissioners in 1851, the green dotted line shows the boundary as claimed by the Persian commissioners; the blue dotted line shows the boundary as claimed by the Ottoman commissioners.The thick black line on the map shows the limits of the map produced by Ely Banister Soane in 1912.Lithographed by Harrison & Sons, London.
